page.title: 05VALE AGRICULTURAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: This area of the eastern Vale of Glamorgan consists of gently rolling hills and broad shallow valleys. Steeper slopes are often wooded with deciduous trees and the small copses and tree lined hedgerows combine to give a rich{rural atmosphere. Settlements are largely restricted to scattered{farms}and small hamlets. The underlying liassic limestone rock gives heavy, though fertile soils, and with the mild wet climate{agriculture is based on grassland. Dairying is the most important activity with most farms milking 80-120 Freesian cows. Grass is re-seeded in either 3 year or 5 year leys, and hay and silage are made for winter feed. Cereal production is limited to animal feedstuffs, usually barley with some maize.
